Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat they have observed (such as a playground, garden, or forest) and include different plants and animals found there.
The student can draw a water habitat they have observed (such as a pond, stream, or lake) and include different plants and animals found there.
The student can include a variety of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can include a variety of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare the different types of living things found in both land and water habitats in their drawing.
The student can show patterns of biodiversity by illustrating how different types of living things exist in different parts of the habitat.
